ZipLedColors: Well known colors for a ZIP strip
ZipLedMode: Different modes for RGB or RGB+W ZIP strips
kitronik.Strip.clear:
Turn off all LEDs.
You need to call ``show`` to make the changes visible.
kitronik.Strip.setBrightness: Set the brightness of the strip. This flag only applies to future operation.
kitronik.Strip.setBrightness|param|brigh: a measure of LED brightness in 0-255. eg: 255
kitronik.Strip.setMatrixColor:
Set LED to a given color (range 0-255 for r, g, b) in a matrix shaped strip 
You need to call ``show`` to make the changes visible.
kitronik.Strip.setMatrixWidth: Sets the number of pixels in a matrix shaped strip
kitronik.Strip.setMatrixWidth|param|widt: number of pixels in a row
kitronik.Strip.setPin: Set the pin where the ZIP LED is connected, defaults to P0.
kitronik.Strip.setPixelColor:
Set LED to a given color (range 0-255 for r, g, b). 
You need to call ``show`` to make the changes visible.
kitronik.Strip.setPixelColor|param|pixel: position of the ZIP LED in the strip
kitronik.Strip.show: Send all the changes to the strip.
kitronik.Strip.showColor: Shows all LEDs to a given color (range 0-255 for r, g, b).
kitronik.ZIP64Display.clear:
Turn off all LEDs on the ZIP64 display.
You need to call ``show`` to make the changes visible.
kitronik.ZIP64Display.setBrightness: Set the brightness of the ZIP64 display. This flag only applies to future operation.
kitronik.ZIP64Display.setBrightness|para: a measure of LED brightness in 0-255. eg: 255
kitronik.ZIP64Display.setMatrixColor:
Set LED to a given color (range 0-255 for r, g, b) in the 8 x 8 matrix 
You need to call ``show`` to make the changes visible.
kitronik.ZIP64Display.setPin: Set the pin where the ZIP LED is connected, defaults to P0.
kitronik.ZIP64Display.show: Send all the changes to the ZIP64 display.
kitronik.ZIP64Display.showColor: Shows whole ZIP64 display as a given color (range 0-255 for r, g, b).
kitronik.checkButtonPress: Input block for :GAME ZIP64 standard buttons
kitronik.checkButtonPress|param|button: press to be checked, eg: Up
kitronik.colors: Gets the RGB value of a known color
kitronik.create: Create a new ZIP LED driver for `numleds` LEDs.
kitronik.createZIP64Display: Create a new ZIP LED driver for :GAME ZIP64 Display.
kitronik.create|param|numleds: number of leds in the strip, eg: 64
kitronik.integer_position: Convert integer number to LED Position
kitronik.onButtonPress:
Do something when one of the :GAME ZIP64 Buttons is pressed
CURRENTLY NOT WORKING
kitronik.pixel_position:
Functions to operate the :GAME ZIP64

Convert 8x8 xy Coordinates to LED Position
kitronik.rgb: Converts red, green, blue channels into a RGB color
kitronik.rgb|param|blue: value of the blue channel between 0 and 255. eg: 255
kitronik.rgb|param|green: value of the green channel between 0 and 255. eg: 255
kitronik.rgb|param|red: value of the red channel between 0 and 255. eg: 255
kitronik.run_motor: Run vibration motor for a particular length of time
kitronik.run_motor|param|run_time: is the length of time the motor will run in ms, eg: 100
kitronik.x_value: Convert integer position number to x coordinate
kitronik.y_value: Convert integer position number to y coordinate
